title: Exponent Rules Mastery
subtitle: Chapter 4: Focus on Essential Exponent Skills
description: 35 comprehensive questions drilling all critical exponent rules and operations - master the foundation of algebra

questions.question: Simplify using the product rule: m⁵ · m²
questions.explanation: Correct! Using the product rule a^m · a^n = a^(m+n), we get m⁵ · m² = m^(5+2) = m⁷.

review.info: Product Rule: When multiplying powers with the same base, ADD the exponents

questions.question: Simplify using the product rule: x⁻³ · x⁵
questions.explanation: Correct! Using the product rule: x⁻³ · x⁵ = x^(-3+5) = x². Remember to add exponents even when they're negative!

review.section: 4.1 Integers as Exponents - Product Rule with Negatives
review.info: The product rule works with negative exponents too: just add algebraically

questions.question: Evaluate: 2³ · 2²
questions.explanation: Correct! Using the product rule: 2³ · 2² = 2^(3+2) = 2⁵ = 32.

review.info: Apply the product rule first, then evaluate the resulting power

questions.question: Using the product rule: a⁴ · a⁶ = a²⁴
questions.explanation: False! The product rule says to ADD exponents, not multiply them. a⁴ · a⁶ = a^(4+6) = a¹⁰, not a²⁴.

review.info: Common mistake: multiplying exponents instead of adding them in the product rule

questions.question: Simplify using the quotient rule: m⁵/m²
questions.explanation: Correct! Using the quotient rule a^m/a^n = a^(m-n), we get m⁵/m² = m^(5-2) = m³.

review.info: Quotient Rule: When dividing powers with the same base, SUBTRACT the exponents

questions.question: Simplify using the quotient rule: m⁴/m⁶
questions.explanation: Correct! m⁴/m⁶ = m^(4-6) = m⁻² = 1/m². When the result has a negative exponent, rewrite with positive exponent.

review.info: If quotient rule gives negative exponent, convert to fraction form

questions.question: Simplify using the quotient rule: y⁶/y⁻³
questions.explanation: Correct! y⁶/y⁻³ = y^(6-(-3)) = y^(6+3) = y⁹. Remember: subtracting a negative is the same as adding!

review.info: When subtracting negative exponents: 6 - (-3) = 6 + 3 = 9

questions.question: Using the quotient rule: x⁸/x² = x⁴
questions.explanation: False! x⁸/x² = x^(8-2) = x⁶, not x⁴. Subtract the exponents: 8 - 2 = 6.

review.info: Common error: dividing exponents instead of subtracting them

questions.question: Rewrite using positive exponents: 3⁻⁴
questions.explanation: Correct! Using a^(-n) = 1/a^n, we get 3⁻⁴ = 1/3⁴ = 1/81. Negative exponent means reciprocal.

review.info: Negative exponent rule: a^(-n) = 1/a^n (move to denominator)

questions.question: Rewrite using positive exponents: 1/2⁻³
questions.explanation: Correct! Using 1/a^(-n) = a^n, we get 1/2⁻³ = 2³ = 8. Moving from denominator to numerator changes sign of exponent.

review.info: When negative exponent is in denominator: 1/a^(-n) = a^n

questions.question: Simplify: 5⁻²
questions.explanation: Correct! 5⁻² = 1/5² = 1/25. A negative exponent creates a fraction, not a negative number!

review.info: Negative exponent ≠ negative number. It means reciprocal.

questions.question: The expression 4⁻² equals -16.
questions.explanation: False! 4⁻² = 1/4² = 1/16 (positive). Negative exponents create fractions, not negative numbers.

review.info: Critical: negative exponent means reciprocal, NOT negative value

questions.question: Evaluate: 2¹
questions.explanation: Correct! By definition, a¹ = a. Any number to the first power equals itself.

review.info: Exponent of 1 rule: a¹ = a (the number itself)

questions.question: Evaluate: (-58)⁰
questions.explanation: Correct! By definition, a⁰ = 1 for any a ≠ 0. Any nonzero number to the zero power equals 1.

review.info: Zero exponent rule: a⁰ = 1 (for a ≠ 0)

questions.question: Any nonzero number raised to the power of 0 equals 0.
questions.explanation: False! Any nonzero number raised to the power of 0 equals 1, not 0. For example: 5⁰ = 1, 1000⁰ = 1.

review.info: Zero exponent always gives 1 (except for 0⁰ which is undefined)

questions.question: What is 0⁰?
questions.explanation: Correct! 0⁰ is undefined. The zero exponent rule a⁰ = 1 only applies when a ≠ 0.

review.info: Special case: 0⁰ is undefined (the only exception to the zero exponent rule)

questions.question: Simplify using the power rule: (y⁴)⁵
questions.explanation: Correct! Using the power rule (a^m)^n = a^(mn), we get (y⁴)⁵ = y^(4·5) = y²⁰.

review.section: 4.2 Exponents and Scientific Notation - Power Rule
review.info: Power Rule: (a^m)^n = a^mn (multiply the exponents)

questions.question: Simplify using the power rule: (m⁶)³
questions.explanation: Correct! (m⁶)³ = m^(6·3) = m¹⁸. Multiply the exponents when raising a power to a power.

review.info: From the book examples: (m⁶)³ = m¹⁸

questions.question: Evaluate: (2²)³
questions.explanation: Correct! (2²)³ = 2^(2·3) = 2⁶ = 64. You can also think of it as (4)³ = 64.

review.info: From book examples: (2²)³ = 2⁶ = 64

questions.question: Simplify: (z⁻⁴)³
questions.explanation: Correct! (z⁻⁴)³ = z^(-4·3) = z⁻¹². The power rule works with negative exponents too!

review.info: Power rule with negative exponents: multiply the exponents algebraically

questions.question: Simplify: (3x²y⁴)²
questions.explanation: Correct! Using (ab)^n = a^n b^n: (3x²y⁴)² = 3² · (x²)² · (y⁴)² = 9x⁴y⁸.

review.info: Raising a product to a power: raise each factor to that power

questions.question: Simplify: (2a³b²)⁴
questions.explanation: Correct! (2a³b²)⁴ = 2⁴ · (a³)⁴ · (b²)⁴ = 16 · a¹² · b⁸ = 16a¹²b⁸.

review.info: Apply the exponent to each factor: coefficient and all variables

questions.question: (ab)³ = a³b³
questions.explanation: True! When raising a product to a power, raise each factor to that power: (ab)^n = a^n b^n.

review.info: Product to a power rule: distribute the exponent to all factors

questions.question: Simplify: (x/y)⁴
questions.explanation: Correct! Using (a/b)^n = a^n/b^n, we get (x/y)⁴ = x⁴/y⁴. Raise both numerator and denominator to the power.

review.info: Quotient to a power: (a/b)^n = a^n/b^n

questions.question: Simplify: (a²b/cd³)⁻³
questions.explanation: Correct! (a²b/cd³)⁻³ = (cd³/a²b)³ = c³d⁹/a⁶b³. Negative exponent flips the fraction, then cube each factor.

review.info: (a/b)^(-n) = (b/a)^n (flip the fraction and make exponent positive)
When dividing with negative exponents, convert each or flip and change signs

questions.question: Convert to scientific notation: 680,000
questions.explanation: Correct! Move the decimal 5 places left: 680,000 = 6.8 × 10⁵. Large numbers have positive exponents.

review.info: For large numbers, count how many places to move decimal left

questions.question: Convert to scientific notation: 0.000567
questions.explanation: Correct! Move the decimal 4 places right: 0.000567 = 5.67 × 10⁻⁴. Small numbers (between 0 and 1) have negative exponents.

review.info: For small numbers (0 to 1), count places to move decimal right (negative exponent)

questions.question: In scientific notation, 4.5 × 10⁶ represents a large number (≥ 10).
questions.explanation: True! A positive exponent in scientific notation indicates a large number. 4.5 × 10⁶ = 4,500,000.

review.info: Positive exponent = large number (≥10); Negative exponent = small number (0 to 1)

questions.question: Convert to decimal notation: 4 × 10³
questions.explanation: Correct! 4 × 10³ = 4 × 1000 = 4000. Move the decimal 3 places to the right.

review.info: Positive exponent: move decimal right that many places

questions.question: Convert to decimal notation: 5.2 × 10⁻³
questions.explanation: Correct! 5.2 × 10⁻³ = 0.0052. Negative exponent means move decimal 3 places to the left.

review.info: Negative exponent: move decimal left that many places

questions.question: Multiply and write in scientific notation: (2.5 × 10⁻⁶)(3.2 × 10⁻⁴)
questions.explanation: Correct! Multiply coefficients and add exponents: (2.5 × 3.2) × 10^(-6+(-4)) = 8 × 10⁻¹⁰.

review.info: To multiply: multiply M values and add exponents (use product rule)

questions.question: Evaluate (6x)³ when x = -3.
questions.explanation: Correct! (6x)³ = [6(-3)]³ = [-18]³ = (-18)(-18)(-18) = -5832. Parentheses mean multiply first, then cube.

review.info: With parentheses (6x)³: multiply first, then raise to power

questions.question: Evaluate 6x³ when x = -3.
questions.explanation: Correct! 6x³ = 6(-3)³ = 6(-27) = -162. Without parentheses, only x is cubed, then multiply by 6.

review.info: Without parentheses 6x³: raise x to power first, then multiply by 6

questions.question: The expressions (6x)³ and 6x³ give the same result when x = -3.
questions.explanation: False! (6x)³ = -5832, but 6x³ = -162 when x = -3. Parentheses change the order of operations!

review.info: Parentheses matter! (6x)³ ≠ 6x³. This is a critical distinction.
